DataElement.preferredName: MICRA 8 Past Week Have Problems Enjoying Life Because of Genetic Test Result Score 4 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated response, in the past week, of having problems enjoying life because of their test result, using a 4 point frequency scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Multidimensional Impact of Cancer Risk Past Week Have Problems Enjoying Life Because of Genetic Test Result Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed as a brief, practical, and targeted assessment of concerns and psychosocial issues associated with the disclosure of results following genetic testing.:The most recent week. May include the present day._A question about whether an individual is having problems enjoying life because of their genetic test result._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes; 0-Never, 1-Rarely, 3-Sometimes, 5-Often

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

Concepts.definition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Added "Sometimes" to represent the MSAS value domain.ghd.01.27.15

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer that something occurs frequently.

Concepts.definition: On many occasions, or in many situations.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Having problems enjoying life because of my test result.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.
